edu.cmu.cs.lane.datatypes

Class SampleBean

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cmu.cs.lane.datatypes.SampleBean

  • public class SampleBean
extends java.lang.Object
    The class SampleBean represents (genetic) information of a specific patient. The actual values are customarily represented as 0:no mutations, 1:mutation on one allele, 2:mutations on both alleles, 3-missing data
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    zinman

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> featureIds
      Array representing the identifiers of the features measured for this sample
      protected java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> featuresInfo
      Array representing additional information can be assigned for each feature (e.g., the specific genetic mutation in a certain location for an individual).
      protected java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Byte> featureValues
      The value of the sample for a specific patient.
      java.lang.String sampleId
      the ID of the sample.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SampleBean()
      default constructor.
      SampleBean(int size)
      a constructor that instantiate a sample with certain number of feature elements.

    • Field Detail

      • sampleId

        public java.lang.String sampleId
        the ID of the sample.

      • featureIds

        protected java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> featureIds
        Array representing the identifiers of the features measured for this sample

      • featuresInfo

        protected java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> featuresInfo
        Array representing additional information can be assigned for each feature (e.g., the specific genetic mutation in a certain location for an individual).

      • featureValues

        protected java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Byte> featureValues
        The value of the sample for a specific patient. (Customary to be represented as 0:no mutations, 1:mutation on one allele, 2:mutations on both alleles, 3-missing data).

      • addFeature

        public void addFeature(java.lang.String id,
              java.lang.String info,
              java.lang.Byte value)
        Parameters:
        id - feature id
        info - feature additional info
        value - feature value as a Byte - customarily represented as 0:no mutations, 1:mutation on one allele, 2:mutations on both alleles, 3-missing data
